(Hey, I just got back, turns out we were only spending two days away from 
home :P Anywho, If I miss something then lemme know, I had to read over a 
hundred e-mails in a half conscious state^_^ This is kinda long, but only 
cause I�m trying to catch up. The others will be shorter, promise.)



Hysteria/Tavatron

Hysteria stopped mid-step and raised her arms slightly, showing that she 
meant no harm. After Chordate lowered his weapon she breathed a sigh of 
relief. She didn�t feel like getting shot at point-blank range. Hysteria 
took a seat at the other console and tapped out a few commands. A diagram of 
the ship came into view on the cracked screen:

"Is there any power left in the main weapons that could be rerouted to the 
shields?"

Hysteria braced herself as the CF shook, but soon settled down again. She 
chuckled softly, though on her face was a look of intense concentration:

"I blame on the lack of off-world contact-- What the slag�?"

So, now they had a gestalt. Things were starting to look up. The again�

"The automated defenses within the ship appear to be functioning, but 
there�s no guarantee they�ll last long enough to stop the intruder."

Hysteria turned her chair around so she was facing Chordate. He didn�t look 
too good, but neither did she. Her armor was cracked and leaking and 
mech-fluid was caked over a cut beneath her right optic:

"D'you think I should try to intercept him?"

*****

Tavatron watched Scattershot fly up high and nearly out of sight. She didn�t 
have time for this. He was insane, no matter what she did he probably 
wouldn�t care. She turned her attention to Dark Wolf after charging her 
staff for several moments. It was whining from the near overload state, put 
managed to miraculously hold itself together. She sent two extremely 
powerful sickle shaped blasts at Dark Wolf. The first blast was vertical and 
immediately followed by a horizontal one. (+ <--like this)
